snippet: Cardinals who will select the next pope would like to find one with the charisma of Pope John Paul II, and the toughness to tackle Vatican disarray.
abstract: Memo from Rome; cardinals who elect next pontiff of Roman Catholic Church appear to be looking for someone who combines charisma of Pope John Paul II with grit to tackle disarray and scandal in Vatican; focus on communication and good governance is in many ways acknowledgement of deficiencies of Pope Benedict XVI.

byline.original: By LAURIE GOODSTEIN and DANIEL J. WAKIN
byline.contributor: Rachel Donadio, Michael Paulson and Jim Yardley contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Cardinals who will select the next pope would like to find one with the charisma of Pope John Paul II, and the toughness to tackle Vatican disarray.

headline.seo: Pope Wanted. Must Possess Magnetic Charm. And Grit.
headline.main: Pope Wanted. Must Possess Magnetic Charm. And Grit.
headline.print_headline: Pope Wanted. Must Possess Magnetic Charm. And Grit.
